fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Management plans without access to voice notifications for Opsgenie alerts still allow a user to configure voice notification rules in their profile. 

The voice notification will fail but continue processing other rules. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select a Jira Service Management plan without voice notifications.
 # Head to your user profile
 # Add a voice notification method
 # Add that voice notification method to a notification rule. 

h3. Expected Results

User is not allowed to add a voice contact method and notification rule if the plan does not allow that type. 
h3. Actual Results

User is allowed to add a voice contact method and notification rule if the plan does not allow that type. 
h3. Workaround

Ensure notification rules include other contact methods (SMS, mobile, email) so that alerts are not missed.
fields.summary: Plan types without access to Opsgenie voice notifications allow users to configure voice notification rules

fields.description:
It’s not possible to use the smart value to access request type info. For example, in Classic {\{issue.Request Type.links.web}} gives a link to the ticket on the portal. This renders nothing in Next-gen.

{\{issue.url.customer}} is meant to be the same thing (link to the ticket on the portal) but also renders nothing.

Updates to the Jira Cloud Platform API will be required for this to function as expected.
fields.summary: Support smart value for Next-Gen request type in Jira Automation

fields.description: Having the ability to take payments from portal for JSD instance would be a much need and used for many from MSP's to install IT bill out the 3rd party vendor they support. We have the ability to track time but not bill we can add time to invoice but not actually invoice into a payment.
fields.summary: Psa integration for portal to take payments from major payment solutions like stripe, waves, paypal, or square. Some of us use the service desk to run helpdesk and it would be nice to bill from our JSD instances.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to turn the *Full name* field required to the sign-in in the portal. 
!Screen Shot 2020-12-04 at 16.23.30.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we could turn this field required.
fields.summary: Ability to turn the Full name field required

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not able to browser Request Participants with special characters in their display names from Jira application. While it works fine on the customer portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a customer with special characters in their display name ('Jörg' for example)
 # Try to set this customer as a Request Participant from the Jira application by searching for 'jorg'

h3. Expected Results

Able to browse the customer and set them as a Request participant
h3. Actual Results

The search returns No user found.
h3. Notes

It does not affect the single user picker field. Also when trying to share the request from the customer portal, able to find the participant with special characters. The customers should not face this issue as they perform this action via the portal.
 Searching with the exact name including the special character 'Jörg' works fine.
The issue does not impact the Crete issue operation. It only impacts the edit issue operation.
h3. Workaround

Search the user with the correct special character. 
 Otherwise, for the JSM project, use the portal link to share the request with the participants with special characters in their display name. You will find the portal link here:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Not able to browser users in multi user-picker field with special characters in their display names from Jira application

fields.description:
Push Other Attributes from an IDP to Atlassian Cloud Managed Profiles

We want to push other attributes from Okta.

Manager

Custom Okta Attributes

Thanks!
fields.summary: Push Other Attributes from an IDP to Atlassian Cloud Managed Profiles

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers are not able to search for existing labels on the customer portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a custom field of type label on a request type
# Create a few labels in the custom field from the Jira application
# Login as a customer and try to create the request type, search the label in the label custom field
 
h3. Expected Results
Once you start typing you will receive suggested labels as well as you can create new labels

h3. Actual Results
The label field keeps loading and returns the following 500 response code in the Developer console:
{noformat}
Request URL: https://yoursite.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/portal/XXX/requestType/XXX/labels/suggest?customFieldId=XXX&query=a
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 500 

{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The issue only impacts a few cloud sites at this time. Also, agents and admins are not impacted. It only impacts customers.

h3.Workaround
Reach out to customer support
fields.summary: Customers are not able to search for existing labels on the customer portal

fields.description: On a public portal or anonymous access enabled portal, when a user submits an anonymous ticket they are required to add in their email address to "*send the confirmation to*". However, to make sure customers don't make any typos it would be nice to have an email confirmation field on the Anonymous ticket creation screen
fields.summary: Public/Anonymous portal with email confirmation step

fields.description:
Currently, there is no way to access incoming email headers while creating or updating issues via email. Providing this ability would be very useful in the following use cases

* Using these headers to build powerful automation rules.
* Using custom headers to populate additional fields via email.
fields.summary: Ability to access incoming email headers while creating or updating issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After using a "Tiny link", the link created from the *Copy link* option at the *Share* button from a Confluence page, in an article from a Knowledge base from JSM, the link isn't rendered properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1. Create a Confluence page and click on the *Copy link* 
  !Copy link.png|thumbnail! 
 2. Create another page and add this link
 !a.png|thumbnail! 
 
 3. Go to JSM portal and access the page with the link

h3. Expected Results

You'll see the page exactly as it's on Confluence, with a text in hyperlink:

 !correct.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

You'll see the "Tiny link" on the page:

 !link.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Instead of using a "Tiny link" use the actual page/article link when using the smart link.

Example: https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/pages/<pageid>/<pagename>
fields.summary: "Tiny link" or Copy link from share option from Confluence isn't rendered properly on JSM portal

fields.description:
As a customer, I want to map the custom fields in Jira Service Management to fields in Opsgenie.

A sample use case would be to map Opsgenie teams to a custom drop down menu called "teams" in JSM. When an alert gets created in Opsgenie, a ticket is created in JSM and the custom field "teams" in JSM is populated with the team assigned to the alert.

This use case can be extended to other Opsgenie components as well. For example alert tags, alert extra properties etc to be mapped with custom fields in JSM.
fields.summary: Field mapping between Opsgenie and Jira Service Management

fields.description:
As a customer, I want to be able to have the Jira ticket automatically linked when an alert is created via the Jira Service Management Integration.
!image-2020-12-02-14-53-42-857.png|width=823,height=563!



I would like similar functionality as the Major Incidents in Jira Service Management that automatically links the Jira incident to the Opsgenie Incident.
fields.summary: Automatically linking Jira ticket when Opsgenie Alerts are created

fields.description:
Currently, not all service projects are shown on the help center even if the customer has permission to access/view them. A plain hyperlink *Explore all* is shown below the tiles that can be overlooked.

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-02 at 1.37.47 pm.png|thumbnail! 

The suggestion is to,

* Make the *Explore all* link more prominent, like a bit bigger in a colored box or border, until the ability to show all service projects becomes available.
* Provide the project administrator the ability to show all service projects on the help center.
fields.summary: Ability to show all service projects on help center

fields.description:
*Update: July 2nd, 2021*

*Hello all,*

*We are currently in progress of consolidating the JSM incident object with the Opsgenie capabilities. This should solve the ask of this ticket. We should start rolling this out in the coming couple of months.*

*Stay tuned!*

*Liron*

*Principal Product Manager*

*Jira Service Management*
----
As a customer, I want to have priority mapping between Opsgenie and Jira Service Management (JSM). When alerts are created in Opsgenie with a particular priority, I want the corresponding tickets to be created in JSM with the same priority.

OG alerts -> JSM Integration ->  JSM tickets.

I would also like to see this feature bidirectional so when creating a ticket in Jira Service Management it will correspond with the associated Opsgenie Alert. Currently, this will create a default P3 alert in Opsgenie and it requires manual intervention to tweak and automate this logic.

JSM tickets -> JSM Integration  -> OG alerts
fields.summary: Priority mapping between Opsgenie and Jira Service Management

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition:

Currently, if there are any issues with the incoming mails the admins would need to manually check the email logs to identify/troubleshoot.
h2. Suggested Solution:

Provide the option to notify the admins when the connection logs show failures. This would be useful for admins to identify and resolve connection issues without having to wait for customers to report it to them.

fields.description:
As a customer, I want to use the incoming call integration in Opsgenie that is joined with Jira Service Management. Currently this is only available on standalone version of Opsgenie. 

This feature request is to make the incoming call integration available for JSM too.
fields.summary: Incoming call integration for Jira Service Management

Information included: article title, categories, views, last updated.
 !print.png|width=504,height=174!
fields.summary: Ability to export information about knowledge base articles

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is a setting on Jira Service Management configuration that prevents agents from updating the organization: *Can agents manage organizations?*.
However there isn't a specific permission to allow users inviting member to the organization.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add separate permissions create/remove organization, to add customer to organization and to remove
fields.summary: Add separate permissions to add customer to organization and to remove

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there are more than 100 characters entered for Request form description , the characters are omitted in the Recently used forms under Help Centre.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project settings -> Request types
 # Navigate to "Request forms" tab. Enter more than 100 characters for both Request form description and Request form help and instructions.

h3. Expected Results

In Help Centre , under "Recently used forms" the text should be displayed correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The text is omitted after the 97th character.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround , we have to limit the no of characters for the description to under 97.
fields.summary: Adding 'Request form Description' with more than 100 characters for the Request types impacts the display in Recently used forms under Help center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a customer, I want the ability to use the ITSM features on the team-managed (formerly next-gen) service project in Jira Service Management (JSM).

For example, if I create an incident in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) service project in JSM, I want the ability to link the JSM incident to an Opsgenie Incident. Currently Opsgenie is not detecting the incidents created in the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project.

Further there is no ability to create major incidents in the team-managed (formerly next-gen) JSM service project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM team-managed (formerly next-gen) service project
 # Create an incident in the newly created project
 # Try to create a major incident or try to link the incident in JSM to an incident in Opsgenie

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to major incidents or link incidents to Opsgenie from the team-managed (formerly next-gen) service project.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to link the incidents between JSM team-managed (formerly next-gen) service project and Opsgenie
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Enable ITSM features on the team-managed (formerly next-gen) Service Project in Jira Service Management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

PRTG integration is failing to create alerts in Opsgenie component of Jira Service Management (JSM). 

PRTG uses the SNI url api.opsgenie.com and sends data to Opsgenie via HTTP POST method.
 The post requests are failing in PRTG due to unsupported HTTP 1.0.

The PRTG logs say :
 Stat disconnected
 HTTP/1.1 426 upgrade required.

Screenshot attached.

!image-2020-11-27-12-05-43-838.png|width=1500,height=332!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a PRTG Integration to Opsgenie
 # Create a PRTG Alert. The alert is not passed to Opsgenie and the HTTP post fails.

h3. Expected Results

The alert in PRTG should create a related alert in Opsgenie.
h3. Actual Results

No alert gets created in Opsgenie from PRTG.
h3. Workaround

We have put together a PowerShell script so that the integration uses Powershell instead of PRTG as the REST client, which will remove the dependency on PRTG's rest client.
h2. What are the dependencies and what OS is supported?
 * Windows Server with Powershell 3 or above.
 * Since it is not possible to set Powershell’s -executionpolicy bypass parameter, the user needs to ensure that the execution policy is set to remotesigned or allsigned.
 * This script has only been tested with the latest version of PRTG, previous versions might not be supported. How to install the script?
h2. How to Install the Script

 # Download and extract the [^PRTG_Workaround.zip]and obtain the Opsgenie.ps1 and Powershell_parameters files.
 # Copy to this location *“C:\Program Files (x86)\PRTG Network Monitor\Notifications\EXE”*
 # Open PRTG, go to *“Setup”* >> *“Account Settings“* >> *“Notification Templates”*
 # Click the blue plus sign located to the right of the *“Notification Templates”* table, then click *“Add Notification Template”*
 # Give the template a name *“OpsgenieScript“* and make sure its status is *“Started“*

!https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/270739490/1367c93d6ac27d1e30fe1b9f/image.png|width=504,height=171!
  

6. Toggle on the option *“Execute Program“*, from the *“Program file“* drop-down list select *“Opsgenie.ps1“.* Open the file *Powershell_parameters* that you downloaded from this page, copy all its content and paste it into the *“Parameters“* field, replace *[API URL]* with the API URL contained in your PRTG integration settings in the Opsgenie UI.
 In *“Domain or Computer name“* you will need to specify Windows Domain name (if the PRTG server is an Active Directory is domain member) or Computer name (if a non Active Directory computer)
 Next, specify a username and password credentials for running the script, please do not use an Administrator user, please create service account user if possible.
 [!https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/270739684/c9b7569fdb4630ef4887403d/image.png|width=1487,height=258!|https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/270739684/c9b7569fdb4630ef4887403d/image.png]
  

7. Lastly, we need to configure triggers. In PRTG select *“Devices“* then click *“Notification Triggers“*, ** Click the *blue plus sign* located to the right of the *“Notification Triggers”* table, then click *“Add State trigger”* configure the following settings:When sensor state is *Down* for at least *60* seconds, perform  *OpsgenieScript*When sensor state is *Down* for at least *300* seconds, perform  *OpsgenieScript* and repeat every *5* minutesWhen sensor leaves *Down* state after a notification was triggered, perform  *OpsgenieScript*Create a second state trigger that handles warnings.When sensor state is *Warning* for at least *60* seconds, perform  *OpsgenieScript*When sensor state is *Warning*  for at least *300* seconds, perform  *OpsgenieScript* and repeat every *5* minutesWhen sensor leaves *Warning* state after a notification was triggered, perform  *OpsgenieScript*|
 [!https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/270739840/63c73294f43f458a4ffbf9c7/image.png|width=704,height=235!|https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/270739840/63c73294f43f458a4ffbf9c7/image.png]
fields.summary: On-premise PRTG integration is failing to create alerts in Opsgenie connected with Jira Service Management

fields.description:
Hi,

I appreciate you had the time to create a new Issue view.

However is is confusing and much slower and doesn't have the necessary information.

At the moment I have to click on 'See the old view' each and every time  I open an issue.

 

I'd appreciate a customer profile level selector(dropdown, whatever) to use the new/old view.

I will definitely choose the old one.
fields.summary: Allow user to chose between old and new view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Under Language Support, we see "1 section needs review" besides the added language even if the UI does not show any pending translations(no yellow dot beside any category)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Have not been able to find what exactly triggers this behaviour
*What we see*
Beside the language, we see "1 section needs review"
h3. Expected Results

We should be able to see and identify the section that has a pending translation with a yellow dot beside it
h3. Actual Results

All the translations have been added and confirmed and there are no pending translations
h3. Workaround

We have seen that sometimes some categories like "Portal content", "Components", "Customer visible status" do not get reflected under Language support.
 They either appear empty or are not shown at all.
 Adding a space beside them and then saving it will trigger these to start getting reflected under Language support with a yellow dot beside them so that we can add the pending translations.
fields.summary: The Language support section displays "1 section needs review" even if there are no pending translations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-597].
{panel}
 # Define a request type in a customer portal.
 # Add a field (for instance 'Description') and set a custom 'Display name' (for instance ('Any additional details you can provide?').
 # Go to the customer portal.
 # Raise a request.
 # Go to the JIRA issue.
 # It would be convenient, from a customer service team member point of view, to know the exact question the customer was asked next to this field. This could be done by adding display name next to the field name. In this case:
{quote}*Description* (Any additional details you can provide?)
{quote}Alternatively, it could be added in a tool tip.
fields.summary: Display next to the field name in JIRA the 'Display name' which has been set in the customer portal for the pertaining request

fields.description:
With the introduction of ITSM customers wish to have a change calendar that shows changes that are planned over a coming period of time. Customers would like to be able to map the planned start and end times of the change on the calendar, so that they can see where teams might be overlapping.
Currently, there is an add-on [Calendar for Jira - Plan Team Activities|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210975/calendar-for-jira-plan-team-activities?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] that provides this functionality, however, we would like this natively built-in with Jira Service management.
fields.summary: Change calendar for Jira Service Management

h3. Issue Summary

When customer satisfaction report has many entries that span multiple pages, clicking on 2nd page duplicates the entries from the first page and displays them on the 2nd page

 # Have multiple CSAT surveys recorded in your project
 # Go to Reports > Satisfaction report.

h3. Expected Results

Records on the 2nd page gets displayed
h3. Actual Results

The records on the first page are displayed and are duplicated increasing the number of entries on the 2nd page to double
h3. Workaround

No workaround for now.

fields.description:

In some scenarios, it does not work as intended specifically due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5614

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The configurations for the outgoing way of JSM integration does not show up in the subordinate Opsgenie account of JSM Standard subscription.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch your plan to JSM Standard. 
 # Go to your subordinate Opsgenie account.
 # Create a new team in Opsgenie.
 # Add a new JSM integration in that team and you will see no option exists for the outgoing way of this integration.

h3. Expected Results

There should be an option one can enable/disable for the outgoing way of JSM integration. 
h3. Actual Results

 

No option exists for the outgoing JSM integration unlike the standalone Opsgenie Essentials plan. 
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
In our business, we use custom icons to differentiate issue types at first sight.
Also, we create sub-tasks for those already differentiated issues.

Right now you can define one single custom icon for sub-tasks.

It would be perfect to define custom icons for sub-tasks based on their parent issue so you can differentiate the type of parent task too by only looking at the icons of the sub-tasks.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Management does not have incoming call integration included in it's list of integrations. However, when going to settings > integrations list, incoming call integration gets listed.

When clicking on the incoming call integration and trying to save the integration, it gives an incorrect message saying

_"Please upgrade your pricing plan for incoming call integration or contact support to enable it"._

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Opsgenie for JSM, Navigate to settings > integrations list
 # The list shows incoming cal integration for JSM
 # Try to create an incoming call integration and save it. It gives the incorrect message.

h3. Expected Results

Incoming call integration should not get listed in the integrations list for JSM
h3. Actual Results

Incoming call gets listed in the integrations list and shows an incorrect error message when trying to create and save the integration.
h3. Workaround

No workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After linking Jira Service Management (JSM) ticket with Opsgenie (OG) incident from the OG incident view, if you go back to JSM and click the ticket, the related OG incident does not show under the linked major incidents.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an incident ticket in JSM
 # Create an incident in Opsgenie
 # In the Opsgenie incident investigation screen, link the incident ticket created in step 1 to the Opsgenie incident created in Step 2.
 # Go back to the ticket in JSM and check if the Opsgenie incident got linked under the "Linked Major Incidents" section in the JSM ticket.

h3. Expected Results

The JSM ticket must automatically show the linked Opsgenie incident under "Linked Major Incidents"
h3. Actual Results

The related OG incident does not show under the linked major incidents.
h3. Workaround

Manually link the major incident in Opsgenie to the JSM ticket using the "Link major incident" option in the JSM ticket.
fields.summary: Opsgenie incident does not get automatically linked in the JSM ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Portal-only customers cannot authenticate cross-site requests to the JSM public API (e.g. to /rest/servicedeskapi/knowledgebase/article?query=article) using session-cookie-based auth in Chrome.

This is likely due to recent changes in Chrome to phase out third-party cookie usage (similar to what Safari has done: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9287) in Chrome by 2022.

For now, this issue can be fixed by explicitly setting the `SameSite` value for customer account session cookies.

References:
* https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/14/21064698/google-third-party-cookies-chrome-two-years-privacy-safari-firefox
* https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5088147346030592

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a service project in JSM with knowledge base
# Create a portal-only user with access as a customer on this service project
# Try to search and view the knowledge base authenticated as the portal-only customer from within a third party app (e.g. Refined Theme).

h3. Expected Results
The portal-only customer can view the knowledge base article (same as an Atlassian account)

h3. Actual Results
The user sees an error that "The action requires a logged in user. Please log in and try again." The API request fails with a 401 response.

h3. Workaround
Use a different browser (e.g. Firefox).
fields.summary: Session cookie auth does not work cross-site in Chrome for portal-only customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We can't edit *Web links* and *Linked issues* once they are added to the issue.
 Therefore, the unique way to achieve this is to remove the linked item and then add a new link with a different link or relationship(in the case of linked issues).
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if we could edit these links, without removing and adding them again.
fields.summary: Ability to edit Web links and Linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Connecting Custom mailbox using Microsoft OAuth to Jira does not work for a managed organization that requires admin approval
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup your Azure AD to prevent users from providing consent to apps accessing company data on their behalf.
 # Only allow admins to approve the mailbox connection request using steps listed here: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/configure-admin-consent-workflow]
 # Try to connect a mailbox that only has a mailbox license
 # Global admin gets the approval request that gets approved by the global admin
 # After approval try to connect the mailbox to Jira again

h3. Expected Results

After the admin's approval, the mailbox can now be connected to Jira
h3. Actual Results

The user again received the same message to request permission to global admin to access the mailbox data
h3. Notes

The only scenario where it works is when the mailbox you are connecting is a global admin who has the permission to approve these requests as well
h3. Workaround

Set up automatic forwarding from your Microsoft inbox to your Jira Service Management project's built-in email address, ending in {{@<site name>.atlassian.net}}. Make sure to add the domain of your Microsoft email address to the project domain allowlist, as per https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/how-are-domains-added-to-the-permitted-list/.
fields.summary: Connecting Custom mailbox using Microsoft OAuth to Jira does not work for a managed organization that requires admin approval

fields.description:
At the moment the create issue dialog on the agent's view looks different based on the viewing user preference to view either *All* or *Custom* fields. This can be different from when the agents raise an issue on the customer's behalf using the *Raise an issue* option from the side panel.


 The ability to make both screens similar would help the agents and administrator enjoy the same UI experience wherever they raise the issue from.

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The CSAT survey is sent upon Resolution being set, together with the Request Resolved notification causing the survey to sometimes being missed

h3. Suggested solution
Separate the notification. A possible solution is to trigger the notification a few minutes after the Request Resolved is already sent.
fields.summary: Separate the CSAT notification from Request Resolved

fields.description: Is being certified for Hippa data on your road map for the near future. Can I get some information for that please. We have clients wanting to use the system for PHI but as far as I know you are not HIPPA certified yet.
fields.summary: When do you anticipate PHI(HIPPA) support in JSM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The landing page for customer portal login shows up as *blank* when the customers are using the *Internet Explorer browser*.
 The landing page should ideally show up the message stating _browser not supported_ like any other unsupported browsers.
The issue happens for multiple customers using different versions of Internet Explorer, clearing the cache and the cookies does not help.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to the customer portal using an IE browser.
 A blank page shows up as the landing page.

h3. Expected Results

The landing page should show up a message stating- _Browser not supported_ like any other unsupported browsers.
h3. Actual Results

The login page for a customer portal login portal shows up as blank when using the Internet Explorer browser.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The landing page for customer portal login shows up a blank page when they are using Internet Explorer browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After restoring a JSM project, the translations could be enabled by default causing request type descriptions to not be editable. Noticed that the translations were not enabled on the source project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Restore JSM project to a new site
 # Edit the request type descriptions

h3. Expected Results
Request Type descriptions editable
h3. Actual Results
Request Type descriptions are not saved upon save.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
event: {message: "Timeout. "sd-language-support" wasn't registered after 30000ms",…}
logTime: "2020-11-16T23:50:29.240Z"
message: "There was a problem getting "sd-language-support" item"
sentFrom: "jira.frontend.navigation-next.imperative-api"

h3. Workaround
Disable all language translations and update the request description again.
fields.summary: Restoring a JSM project might cause the translations to be corrupted

fields.description:

# Add more than 20 [Excerpt Include|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/excerpt-include-macro-148067.html] Macros
# Save the page and try to access it via the portal.

h3. Expected Results
The page takes a while to load but works just fine.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown at the customer portal:
{noformat}
{
    "errors": [{
        "errorMessage": "There was a problem contacting the application."
    }],
    "reasonKey": "sd.applinks.error.bad.request",
    "reasonCode": "500"
}
{noformat}

Application logs:
{noformat}
logger: com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.api.applink.BaseAppLinkResponseHandler
message: A ResponseException was encountered communicating with an applink A ResponseException was encountered communicating with an applink with the following message
...
Caused by: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)

{noformat}

Split the content across multiple pages.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New tickets are not shown in the queue when it's transitioned to the new created status. It happens for Next-gen project type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-gen project type
 # Project Settings > Request Types (pick any Request type) > Edit Workflow
 # Create a new status by clicking  "To-do status" at the top. To make it easier, tick "Allow requests in any status to move to this one"
 # Save it
 # Create some issues and transition it to the newly created status.
 # Navigate back to the queue: [https://URL.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/|https://url.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/]<pkey>/queues/custom/<ID>

h3. Expected Results

Issue is shown in Queue
h3. Actual Results

All issues that are transitioned to the newly created status are not shown in the queue.
h3. Workaround

Simply updating the workflow even by just moving any statuses by a few pixels.
fields.summary: New ticket is not shown in the queue when it's transitioned to newly created status

fields.description:
The situation: a service desk customer says they can't login to the portal. I tell them to go to the portal link in Chrome, enter their email address and select Forgot Password. 
If their default browser is IE, when they click the link they are taken to 'Browser not supported by Jira' (screenshot attached).

This is not a good user experience.

Can you improve the wording on the 'Reset your password' email. It should make clear that IE should not be used. And it should say something like 'copy the link and paste it in Chrome/Firefox'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The only possible way to identify if an organization is in use by a project is to navigate to the project's Customer list and see if the organization is added there. 

There's no "one-stop config" page where all organizations are listed and to which project they are added. 

Since organizations can be removed from a project while not being deleted from the site, there's no place for admins to identify these organizations (for maintenance) unless they are added to a project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a customer organization management configuration where admins would be able to configure access for organizations and perform maintenance actions.
fields.summary: Add Customer Organization Management

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It appears that using the feature "Create Linked Issue" from a ticket that has an organization to another Service Desk project will throw "Invalid organization ids specified" Error Message if the same organization does not exist in the target project.

h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Have 2 Service Desk Project ready.
 # Create an Organization to SD Project A
 # In one of SD Project A, set the Organization to it.
 # After it, use the "More > Create Linked Issue" and select SD Project B as the target.
 # Click "Create"

h3. Expected Result:
 - The linked ticket will be created.

h3. Actual Result:
 - An error message "Invalid organization ids specified" will be thrown

h3. Workaround
 - Add the same Organization to SD Project B before creation.
 - Contact support
fields.summary: Unable to create linked issue if the target project does not have the same Organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Queue section in the left sidebar doesn't respect issue security scheme setting
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project and associate it with Issue security scheme 
 # Create 2 Issue security levels where:
 ** Security Level 1: Add Group A
 ** Security Level 2: Add Group B
 # Create 2 issues where:
 ** Issue 1 (ABC-1) with _issue security level 1_
 ** Issue 2 ABC-2) with _issue security level 2_
 # Add a user in both groups and open the unassigned queue
 ** [https://URL.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues/custom/|https://url.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues/custom/]<queue ID>
 # Both ABC-1 and ABC-2 are shown and the number of issues in "Unassigned queue" in the left side bar shows 2 (/)
 # Now, remove the user from either Group A or B

h3. Expected Results
 * Only one of the issues shown
 * The number of issues in "Unassigned queue" in the left side bar shows 1

h3. Actual Results
 * Both issues are shown in the list of issues. However, when user clicks the issue he shouldn't have access to, it says "You don't have access to the issue".
 * The number of issues in "Unassigned queue" in the left side bar shows 2
 * Below is the sample where it should show 30 (instead of 31)
 ** !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * If "Description" field is added to the list of columns being shown, the value will be shown in the "Unassigned Queue" issue list. This would allow other users who shouldn't access the issue, to be able to see the value of Description.
 * It works fine if the user searches from "Issue Navigator" where Jira will hide the issues the user shouldn't see.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Queue in the sidebar doesn't respect issue security scheme setting

fields.description:
Oi pessoal, tudo bem?Oi pessoal, tudo bem?Participei de um challenge, onde eu deveria apontar uma melhoria em um produto B2B. E, com base em minha experiência, pontuei uma necessidade de dia a dia utilizando a plataforma de vocês pela visão de Product Meneger. Espero que gostem e aproveitem para me ajudar com essa feature :) Obrigada!
Segue:
1. Purpose of document
 O documento a seguir aborda a inexistência da métrica de Story Points na feature Dashboard do produto Jira, como um problema de experiência do cliente.Propõe como solução e melhoria, a inclusão de um de/para no componente Story Points do card de atividades do usuário. Que possibilitará ao usuário a atribuição de escalas de complexidade para cada atividade, sendo posteriormente refletidas como dimensões no Dashboard, como desejado.
2. Tenets/guidelines/background
O Jira é uma software comercial que permite o monitoramento de tarefas e acompanhamento de projetos, garantindo o gerenciamento de diversas atividades de uma equipe em único lugar. Essa ferramenta é utilizada por um grande cliente, para a gestão de atividades de seus times.Uma das funcionalidades do Jira, é acomodar informações relevantes de uma atividade em seus cards, como a informação de Story Points. O  cliente utiliza Story Points para planejamento de atividades que serão incluídas no roadmap da Sprint. Os pontos são atribuídos para mensurar a complexidade de atividades que estão sendo realizadas em cada ciclo de trabalho.O Jira já oferece um campo texto em seus componentes para que o usuário atribua os Story Points em seus cards de atividades. Porém, os Story Points não estão contidos nas dimensões disponibilizadas na feature de Dashboard do produto.A ausência dessa dimensão está prejudicando a experiência do cliente para gerir a complexidade de atividades realizadas por seus times, de acordo com determinado espaço de tempo.
3. Details of the problem
 Na página inicial do sistema Jira encontra-se a feature de Dashboard. A ferramenta possibilita a criação de relatórios de acompanhamento de atividades de usuários. A dimensão Story Points ainda não se encontra habilitada como métrica na ferramenta de Dashboard, impactando na usabilidade do cliente. É importante mencionar que o componente Story Points é um campo texto, que atualmente pode ser preenchido com caracteres alfanuméricos. O cliente tem relatado essa crítica como um impeditivo de continuidade de usabilidade pela cia.
4. Details of possible solutions Duas possíveis soluções foram mapeadas como iniciativas de melhoria para o sistema:*  A inclusão de uma flag no card de issues, que possibilite ao usuário selecionar se aquele Story Point deve ou não compor as métricas de acompanhamento. Caso positivo, o usuário necessariamente deverá atribuir caracteres numéricos.*  A criação de tabelas de de/para, onde os usuários atribuiriam pesos para cada Story Point informado. Possibilitando a inclusão de todos os tipos de Story Points no Dashboard.

5. Recommended solution
 A solução recomendada é a criação de caixas de de/para, onde os usuários atribuirão pesos para cada Story Point. Essa solução atingirá todos os clientes, possibilitando que seus Story Points sejam inseridos como métricas no Dashboard. Os clientes relataram que a função de de/para seria eficiente, pois possibilitaria a inserção da métrica de Story Points em seus relatórios com mensuração de complexidade de atividades. A solução permitirá que todos os clientes consigam mensurar a complexidade de atividades dos ciclos de trabalho de seus times. A primeira solução não foi indicada, pois existem também conceitos alfanumérico de atribuição de pesos à atividades, não atendendo à uma massa relevante de clientes que já utilizam o produto.
6. Plan of action
O plano de ação realizado nessa atividade foi:
Alinhamento estratégico: Atribuição de objetivo e métricas de sucesso impactadas pelo contexto do problema. 

Levantamento de oportunidades: Identificação de demais dores dos usuários; Realização de entrevistas com stakeholders (tanto com o time de desenvolvimento, quanto com o cliente); realização de benchmarking para entender como está o mercado e as atuais necessidades desse tipo de cliente; validação de persona e aplicação de técnica 5 Whys.

Priorização de oportunidades: Medição de impacto de cada oportunidade e priorização através do método RICE; entrevista com o time de desenvolvimento para compreensão de viabilidade e realização de análise de risco de cada solução proposta. 

Levantamento e validação de soluções: Identificação de possíveis soluções e validação de hipótese; prototipagem de soluções; teste de usabilidade e entrevista com grupo focal.
fields.summary: Como usuária Jira, gostaria de possuir a dimensão de Story Points na feature de Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/write-and-search-for-knowledge-base-articles-956713329.html], we can see that, in the Server version of Jira Service Desk, when you link a Confluence knowledge base to your service desk, a "Search help" link appears below the search field. 

However, we don’t have this functionality in the Cloud version.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if within the project configuration we could add this option to the customer portal in the Cloud version.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Registering a customer account thru portal with an already registered Atlassian account email sends an activation email with broken activation link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a tenant, invite a person to become an agent (effectively creating an Atlassian account)
 # (optional) Activate the new Atlassian account by clicking the link in the activation email
 # Go to the service desk portal in a new browser session (e.g. [https://yliew.atlassian.com/servicedesk]) and register a customer account with the person's email address (same as 1)
 # Another email will be sent and click on the activation link

h3. Expected Results

-The portal should not allow registering a customer account with an already existed Atlassian account (in the tenant) -  see attachment-

Jira should not send the account registration email for existing Atlassian accounts. Do we want to show `_an account already exists for this email_` in the portal?
h3. Actual Results

An activation email is sent to the Atlassian account email address. Clicking on the link directs me to the portal and shows "The link is bad". - see attachment
h3. Workaround

Remove the Atlassian account from the site to allow the Atlassian account email address to be registered as a customer account
fields.summary: Registering a customer account thru portal with an already registered atlassian account email sends an activation emails with broken activation link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding a new custom field to a screen, it will be added to all Request Types mapped to that Issue Type. If there are multiple Request Types mapped to a single Issue Type, the custom field would be added to all Request Types by default
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to set newly added custom fields to be hidden by default to avoid confusion to users who don't use the field
fields.summary: Add ability to hide new custom fields from agent view by default

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attachment panel in new issue view only shows the attachments added from Jira application or added during request creation from the portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try the tests mentioned under Actual results and see the results

h3. Expected Results

Can see all the attachments from Jira in the Attachment panel in both the new issue view as well as old issue view
h3. Actual Results
||Test||Visibility in Attachment panel - Old issue view||Visibility in Attachment panel - New issue view||
|As an agent raise a request on behalf of the customer from the portal and attach files|(/)|(/)|
|As a customer raise a request from the portal and attach files|(/)|(/)|
|On a request raised from the portal, as a customer add another attachment with a comment from customer portal|(/)|(x)|
| On a request raised from the portal, as an agent add another attachment with a comment from customer portal| (/)| (x)|
|On a request raised from the portal, as an agent add another attachment with a comment from Jira application| (/)|(/) |
h3. Workaround
 # Use the old issue view to view all the attachments in one place and download them
 # Or Use direct links:
 ** Download All
{code:java}
https://<JIRA_Domain>/secure/attachmentzip/<Issue_ID>.zip{code}

 * 
 ** Manage _(Download All is available on this page)_
{code:java}
https://<JIRA_Domain>/secure/ManageAttachments.jspa?id=<Issue_ID>{code}
(+) To get issue ID in the new view:

 * Click the {{...}} button on the top right side
 * Hover the mouse onto Clone or Delete
 * See issue ID from browser's status bar

h3. Notes

The attachment panel was recently included in the new issue view: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2020/10/atlassian-cloud-changes-oct-19-to-oct-26-2020]
{quote}New issue view: View your attachments the way you want
View all your attachments (including those from fields, comments, and work log entries) in either a strip or list, or switch between the two. It’s up to you.
{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As due to GDPR changes based on documentation below , user email address can be set it visibility :-

https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-968656104.html

However, even though the email address visibility set to "Only me and admin" , "Domain of Reporter" field value still not visible to the administrator.


h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a customer account email visibility to "Only me and admin"
# Then, create a custom field with "Domain of Reporter" type
# Migrate the customer account to Atlassian account
# Create a ticket on behalf of customer
# View the issue from JIRA using administrator account

h3. Expected Results
Reporter domain populated.

h3. Actual Results
Reporter domain not populated.


h3. Workaround
Set the email visibility to "Anyone"

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

For sites with large number of articles, sorting by last update time (which is the default sort right now) is not very useful. And makes it hard to guess where in the list an article will appear.

Also, we want to be able to quickly see which articles are used the most, and the least.

Also, we are no longer able to see the total number of articles in the knowledge base, and have to page through them slowly. See [JSDCLOUD-8673|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8673]

 

*Suggested solution:*
 * Allow the user to change sorting order by clicking on ANY of the column headers, but especially on the VIEWS header
fields.summary: Ability to sort knowledge base articles by views

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For a few customers, Automation option in a service desk project redirects you to the Automation for Jira without an option to navigate to Legacy Automation

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# For a classic service desk project navigate to Project Settings > Automation

h3. Expected Results
by default first, the Automation for Jira should load along with the Automation navigation bar on the left side that should display the option to navigate to Legacy Automation 


h3. Actual Results
When you click on Automation, it shows the Automation navigation bar for a quick second and then redirects you back to the Project settings navigation bar. It successfully displays the Automation for Jira. But now you do not have an option to navigate to legacy Automation

h3.Workaround
Use the direct link to access the Legacy Automation: 
{noformat}
https://<yourinstance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/<PROJECT-KEY>/automation
{noformat}
fields.summary: Automation option in a service desk project redirects you to the Automation for Jira without an option to navigate to Legacy Automation

fields.description:

The only way to know is by checking their IDs and comparing them to the IDs in the Customer Portal or by changing their icons.

It would be better to add a direct link to the request type from the portal group page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachments from previous issue displayed are persisting when you browse to another issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue that has attachments (issue view)
 # Click on a queue and select another issue

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing the Master page with Children Display Macro, which contains Children pages with Excerpt Macro, then the images in the Excerpt macro in the children pages are not loading, it shows a broken image.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Confluence space linked to a Jira Service Desk project.
# Create a page under this space.
# Create another page within the page created in Step 2.
# Add an *Excerpt Macro* and add an image within this macro.
# Now on the page created in Step 2, add a Children Display macro.
# From confluence when you see the page that has the Children Display macro it displays an image added in the *Excerpt Macro* from Step 4.
# When you see this page in the portal the image does not load and shows a broken Image.

h3. Expected Results
When viewing the page which has Children Display macro it should load the image added in Excerpt Macro on the child pages.
h3. Actual Results
Does not load any image, it just shows a broken image.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images are not displayed in the portal for pages having Excerpt Macro, used within Children Display Macro.

fields.description: There is not currently a button on the screen to create a new ticket from the view requests screen. End users can get there by clicking the Help Center icon at the top left, but this is asking a lot from a user experience standpoint. I am trying to get my users to use the service desk portal rather than sending in emails. This is primarily because they send new emails rather than replying to existing emails so I end up with hundreds of duplicate tickets. They end up reverting to sending emails because they can't find out how to create a new ticket from the screen that lists all their current tickets. While I know this is an end user problem, that's not a problem I'm going to be able to solve anytime soon. It would create help me if they had a "Submit new ticket" button on the screen so when they see there isn't an existing ticket for their current problem, they can click that button and get right to creating a new ticket.
fields.summary: Add a button to create a new ticket to the view tickets screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The 'Update Issue Field' post-function won't check if the user selected as Assignee has a license or project permissions, making it possible to assign issues to:
 * Users without a Jira Service Desk license
 * Users without the 'Browse projects' and 'Assignable User' permissions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a workflow, adding the 'Update Issue Field' to a transition (please note that [Post-function on Create Issue transition appears to not work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/post-function-on-create-issue-transition-appears-to-not-work-718836210.html])
 # In the post-function configuration, select the 'Assignee' field and choose a user that doesn't have the proper permissions or license to assign issues in that project
 # Publish your workflow and create a test issue

h3. Expected Results

It's not possible to select invalid users in the post-function configuration
h3. Actual Results

The post-function assigns issues to the selected user even without a license/permissions.
fields.summary: Update Issue Field post-function can assign issues to unlicensed users

fields.description:
Currently, when the invitation email is sent to the customer, there is no information provided in the email regarding the validity or expiry of the invitation link. The service desk administrators also don't have an option to view this information for the invited customers.

The suggestion is to include this information in the email to the customers and also provide the service desk administrators an option to view this information for the invited customers. Like how much invitation link validity is remaining for which customer.
fields.summary: Customer invitation expiry/validity information request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Jira instance has a Service Desk project and no active Jira Service Desk subscription, a user can still navigate to the project's Service Desk-specific project settings pages, and sees a variety of error pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Jira instance that has an active Jira Service Desk subscription
 # Create a Service Desk project
 # Cancel/de-activate the Jira Service Desk subscription
 # Navigate to the Service Desk project's "Portal settings" page (or another Service Desk project settings page)

h3. Expected Results
 * The option to navigate to the "Portal settings" page is not present; or
 * An error page is displayed that calls out that the Jira Service Desk subscription is inactive

h3. Actual Results
 * An error page is displayed: either just a big error icon or a page saying "You must be a Service Desk Agent to view this page"

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When loading Service Desk-specific project settings on a tenant that no longer has an active Jira Service Desk subscription, a misleading error page is shown.

fields.description:
As a service manager, I would like to be able to filter results by whether or not a request has been resolved with a KB article so that I can determine which services (components) need KB improvement. 

Ideally, this would show up as a column that could be pulled into the filter view, maybe as a flag "resolved with kb". If the KB article could be included as another column that would be spectacular, but not as important as the "resolved with KB" flag.
fields.summary: JQL for Requests resolved with an article

fields.description:
Currently, when the customer access a request form with a Select List custom field, Jira will load all options for that field. This will timeout when there are thousands of options.

It'd be better to have a limited number of options loading first, then show suggestions based on the content typed by the user, similar to how User Picker fields function.
fields.summary: Add a limit to the amount of options that are loaded as suggestions of a Select List custom field on the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding an Atlassian account to the *Customers* section of a JSD project doesn't send the welcome email to the Atlassian account customer. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add invite an Atlassian account to your site
# Go to the *Customers* section of a JSD project
# Add the Atlassian account as customer
(While having the *Customer invited* customer notification enabled) 

h3. Expected Results

Atlassian account customer receive the welcome notification.
h3. Actual Results

No notification is received.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Customer Atlassian account doesn't receive welcome invite email when being added to a JSD project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

SLA calculated incorrectly when you change issue type of an issue and the SLA cycle has completed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an SLA *Time to first response* that looks as follows, one of the SLA stop condition should be Resolution Set
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Create another SLA metric *Time to resolution* that looks like below, one of the SLA stop condition should be Resolution Set
 !Time to resolution.png|thumbnail!
 # Create an issue of type *IT Help*, it will be created with an ongoing SLA *Time to first response* with target 7h30m
 # Change the issue type to something other than *IT Help* but uses the same workflow, the SLA will accordingly get updated to an ongoing SLA *Time to resolution* with target 336h
 # Try to change the issue type a few times, the SLA information is still updated correctly as per the issue type
 # Now with an issue type, *IT Help* and ongoing SLA *Time to first response* with target 7h30m, resolve the request by setting *Resolution* field after 5 minutes, an SLA stop condition for both the SLA's
 # The SLA will be *Time to first response* with completed at *7h25m* 
 # Now change the issue type from *IT Help* to some other issue type after two minutes
 # The SLA information will still be reflected as *Time to first response* with completed at *7h25m* when it should be updated to a completed cycle of *Time to resolution 335h55m* due to issue type chnage  

h3. Expected Results

SLA information is displayed correctly
h3. Actual Results

The SLA information is in an inconsistent state
h3. Workaround

Execute the SLA recalculation endpoint to correct the SLA information 
 * [SLAs in Jira Service Desk Cloud are missing or disappear|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-desk-disappear-954252774.html]
fields.summary: SLA calculated incorrectly when you change issue type of an issue and the SLA cycle has completed

fields.description:
Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to customize the appearance of articles on the portal. With the user of Categories, it is possible to make it appear as a single stop for all articles but the look and feel needs to be improved

Suggested Solution

Allow adding more graphic context to make the page look more alive.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the look and feel of articles on the portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to edit the fields of the widget.  The fields *How can we help?, Contact us about, Powered by JIRA Service Desk, Your contact e-mail, and Send button* can't be changed.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if we could edit fields on the widget.

fields.description:
Once I discovered Jira's existing shortcuts it has drastically increased productivity with my and my advanced users. I'm also glad that the keyboard shortcut of 'm' now defaults to an internal comment per JSDCLOUD-1733. 
However, there is no keyboard shortcut for responding to a customer. Please add this to the list of shortcuts. 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut for "Respond to Customer"
Ability to add images in request form in customer portal
Ability to display the multi-line text fields in shortened form
Allow customers to create and edit their organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to edit *alert users* text in automation rules.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom automation rule
 # *WHEN:* Any event type
 # *THEN:* Alert users
There's no option to edit/customize the text.

h3. Workaround
Check the username under User management:
 * https://<INSTANCE_URL>.atlassian.net/admin/users
Use the *Add a comment* functionality and mention users using the syntax below:
{noformat}
My comment .... [~USERNAME]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to edit alert users text in automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In some Atlassian Cloud sites, if a custom field called *Resolution* is created, issues from NextGen projects will start showing up on the *Your work* > *Assigned to me* tab.

h3. Expected Results

Issues from the NextGen project will not show up on the *Assigned to me* due to JRACLOUD-73637

h3. Actual Results

JRACLOUD-73637 will be bypassed and issues NextGen issues will show up on the 
 
h3.Workaround
None at the moment

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

In the old issue view, we have *Approvals* section which shows who all approved among the list of approvers but in the new issue view, we have only *Approvers* field which lists all the approvers but not any information on whether they approved/rejected waiting for approval.

+New issue view+

!NewIssueView.png|width=458,height=278!

 +Old issue view+

!OldIssueView.png|width=506,height=334!

*Suggested Solution*

An *Approvals* section will be helpful in knowing the status of requested approval.
fields.summary: Need Approvals section in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For some customers, the Approvals page is too slow to load on the customer portal. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The exact steps to reproduce this behavior are still unknown.
 # Enter the customer portal;
 # Click on Requests;
 # Select *Approvals*

h3. Expected Results
The page and the issues that require approval loads in a few seconds 

h3. Actual Results
It takes around 30 seconds for the page to display results. After the page loads, it takes an additional 10 seconds for Jira to receive a response from the server about the list of issues to display

h3. Notes
The problem appeared after the customer hit the bug JSDCLOUD-9104 that caused the approval page to time out. Now the page doesn't timeout but the list is too slow to load even for a small number of issues pending approval.
Reach out to the Atlassian support for further investigation

h3. Workaround
None a this time
fields.summary: For some customers Approvals page is too slow to load on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Approve" and "Decline" buttons are not shown on the first load in detail view. The button appears when we try to re-load it. This leads to missing a ticket that should be approved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move the ticket to a status that requires approval
 # Open the issue in detail view using the search and so on

h3. Expected Results
"Approve" and "Decline" buttons are shown
 !スクリーンショット 2020-10-20 17.17.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
"Approve" and "Decline" buttons are not shown
 !スクリーンショット 2020-10-20 17.17.20.png|thumbnail! 
After reloading, we can see both buttons

h3. Workaround
Open the ticket from the link in the notification email.
fields.summary: Approve and Decline buttons are not shown on the first load in detail view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, after adding "jira.permission.comment" workflow properties in Closed status , it will stopped comment via JIRA , Customer Portal and email. However, when an email processed, it created a new issue instead. This causing duplicate tickets. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Option to ignore or reject email that trying to add a comment to Closed issue. 

h3. Why this is important
Prevent duplicate issue.
fields.summary: Option to ignore/reject incoming email that would like to add comment to closed issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using POP3S as email protocol, it might cause a SocketException which causes duplicate issues to be created from a single email received to the mailbox.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an email request by connecting a mailbox via POP

h3. Expected Results

A single issue being created from a single email
h3. Actual Results

Sometimes, duplicate issues can be created from a single email
h3. Workaround
 * Increase the timeout on the mail server - connection gets closed by the server when the client (JSD in this case) is still trying to fetch chunks — ie. connection timeout is too short causing timeout exceptions. So to avoid this the customer can possibly increase the timeout on the mail server.
 * Ensure SSL certificates are configured correctly - these can cause SSL exceptions (a type of socket exception) if misconfigured
 * Use IMAP instead of POP
fields.summary: Using POP3S as email protocol may cause duplicate issues to be created
The ability to put grey pre-type text in Jira request forms

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JSD project create is failing at the SLA creation step, causing projects to be created in a semi-working state. Projects created might be missing:

# SLAs
# SLA columns on queues - eg Time to Resolution in the 'All Open Tickets' queue
# Custom reports eg 'SLA success rate', 'Time to Done', 'SLA met vs breached'
# Knowledge base
# Agents may need to be manually added to the first created project
# Demo issues will never be created

h3. Workaround
# If the project is not yet in use, create a new project which will have all the missing configurations
# Add the default SLA manually eg Time to Resolution
# Add the SLA column to the queues manually
# Manually create reports eg 'SLA success rate', 'Time to Done', 'SLA met vs breached'
# Manually link KB to Confluence space
# Manually add agents to the project

If you have any questions, please contact support for further assistance.
fields.summary: JSD Project create is failing at SLA creation and creating incomplete projects

fields.description:
If you go to https://<site>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa and try to delete a JSD custom mail handler, without having access to the affected project you'll receive the following error:

"Something has gone wrong with your request. If symptoms persist contact your system administrator"

 !error message.png|thumbnail! 

This suggestion is to improve this error message to inform that the reason is due to the fact that you don't have permissions project-level to perform this action
fields.summary: Improve error message when deleting mail handler

fields.description:

# try to edit Holidays
#*  !Screen Shot 2020-10-13 at 18.35.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
It's possible to edit it.

h3. Actual Results
* It's not possible to edit it due to an error
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-13 at 18.33.27.png|thumbnail! 

* Console error
{code}
captureconsole.js:63 RangeError: Invalid time value
    at Ue.formatDate (DatePicker.tsx:475)
    at Ue.render (DatePicker.tsx:587)
    at Pi (react-dom.production.min.js:182)
    at xi (react-dom.production.min.js:181)
